meanings.definition: To protect or shield from heat, cold, or sound
meanings.sent1: The thick blanket insulates the baby from the chilly air.
meanings.sent2: Adding extra layers of clothing insulates your body from the cold weather.
meanings.sent3: The cozy fireplace insulates the room, making it a warm and inviting space.
meanings.sent4: The fluffy snow insulates the ground, keeping it from freezing completely.
meanings.sent5: The insulated walls of the house keep the indoor temperature comfortable.

meanings.definition: To prevent the passage of electricity
meanings.sent1: Rubber gloves insulate the hands from electric shocks.
meanings.sent2: The plastic covering on wires insulates them to avoid electrical accidents.
meanings.sent3: The rubber duckies in the bathtub insulate against any electrical currents.
meanings.sent4: The thick rubber mat insulates the floor, ensuring safety from electricity.
meanings.sent5: Insulated cables are used to protect against electrical interference.

meanings.definition: To separate or detach from surroundings
meanings.sent1: The high walls insulate the garden from the noise of the city.
meanings.sent2: Using headphones can insulate you from distractions while studying.
meanings.sent3: The noise-canceling headphones insulate the listener from unwanted sounds.
meanings.sent4: The secluded cabin insulates its residents from the hustle and bustle of urban life.
meanings.sent5: The thick curtains insulate the room, creating a peaceful environment.
